result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Rebbecca L. Kerner in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Defendant Rebbecca L. Kerner in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Also has 14 CF 159 and 13 CF 208.  10:34 AM  Court calls cases and recites appearances.  State recites plea - amend info 15 CF 62 to delivery of schedule 2 narcotic class E felony 961.41(1)(a) - and count 1 in 13 cf 208 plead guilty and 14 CF 159 would be dismissed and read-in.  8 yrs prison - 3 years in 5 yrs ES - restitution $1020.00 - DNA sample/surcharge and costs in each file - adopt conditions from PSI to be ordered. Victim rights have been complied with.  Atty Chapman agrees as does the defendant.  Court questions defendant as to plea questionnaire.  Court grants motion to amend 15 CF 62.  Defendant entered plea of guilty  to count 1 as amended in 15 CF 62 and count 1 in 13 CF 208.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended 15 CF 62 count 1 and 13 CF 208 and 14 CF 159 is dismissed and used as a read-in.  COURT:  PSI ordered - short form and no agent need appear - all bonds revoked remanded to Sawyer County Sheriff's Dept.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Attorney Chapman and DA Bruce Poquette

Defendant Rebbecca L. Kerner in court with attorney Daniel James Chapman by phone .  Defendant Rebbecca L. Kerner in custody in Sawyer County,   Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsinby phone, Judge is by Video from Bayfield County and has both counsel on the phone.   Here to set JT date - demand for Speedy Trial on 15CF62  other cases tracking along, court will issue trial outline deadlines  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rebbecca L. Kerner in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Off record.

No abusive contact with  -  Brian T. Zimmerman
Statutory Minimum Domestic Abuse Bail Conditions
As a condition of my release from custody in this matter, I agree that I will not engage in any threats or acts of domestic abuse against the victim "    " or any other person.
I understand that "domestic abuse" means:
Intentional infliction of physical pain, injury or illness.
Intentional impairment of physical condition. 
First, second or third degree sexual assault.  
A physical act that may cause the other person reason to fear imminent engagement in the conduct described above, including but not limited to the intentional destruction of physical property.
Absolute sobriety.  No consumption of alcoholic beverages.

Defendant Rebbecca L. Kerner in court with attorney Martin Jarvis.  Bruce R. Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Advised of rights; ack. receipt of information.  NG plea entered; NG pleas entered for Ct. 2, 3, & 4 of complaint.  Attorney Jarvis requests bond modification to allow contact with Brian T. Zimmerman.  Court amends bond to include the Domestic Abuse language, absolute sobriety; no consumption of alcoholic beverages.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Bruce Poquette appeared on behalf of the State.  Rebecca Kerner appeared in person wtih Attorney Martin Jarvis.  

DE waived preliminary hearing.  Court binds DE over.  Attorney for DE motions to amend contact and lift no contact or modify no contact.  State objects.  Court rejects motion for lifting no contact.  Court will allow non-violent telephone contact only.
Only non-violent telephone contact with Brian T. Zimmerman; absolute sobriety; no consumpution of alcoholic beverages.  Amended bond.
